direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve specific parts of the error code, with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods handle the error class, one for setting and the other for retrieving.
Both methods are related to the error code, with getErrorCode() combining error class and number.
Both methods handle error codes and provide related information, though one provides the class and the other a reason phrase.
Both methods involve handling and processing error-related data, with encode() preparing the data for binary representation.

enhanced_by.reason: Setting the error class is necessary before retrieving it, ensuring the state is correctly initialized.
Setting the error code initializes both the error class and number, which are dependencies for getErrorClass().
Retrieving the error code can be used to verify the correctness of the error class and number before accessing the error class.
The default reason phrase can be used to verify the correctness of the error class by checking if the error code corresponds to the expected reason phrase.
The equals method can be used to verify that the error class and other attributes are correctly set and retrieved.
